org.osgeo.mapguide

Class MgCoordinateSystemMeasure

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.osgeo.mapguide.MgObject
      • org.osgeo.mapguide.MgDisposable
        • org.osgeo.mapguide.MgGuardDisposable
          • org.osgeo.mapguide.MgMeasure
            • org.osgeo.mapguide.MgCoordinateSystemMeasure

  • public class MgCoordinateSystemMeasure
extends MgMeasure
    Provides operations for measuring the distance between 2 coordinates and the azimuth of 2 coordinates as well as calculating a coordinate position given an initial coordinate, an azimuth, and a distance.

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance(MgCoordinate coord1,
                          MgCoordinate coord2)
        Computes the distance between two coordinates.
        Overrides:
        getDistance in class MgMeasure
        Parameters:
        coord1 - (MgCoordinate) An MgCoordinate object that specifies the first coordinate.
        coord2 - (MgCoordinate) An MgCoordinate object that specifies the second coordinate.
        Returns:
        Returns the distance between coord1 and coord2 as a double in meters.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgCoordinateSystemMeasureFailedException

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance(double x1,
                          double y1,
                          double x2,
                          double y2)
        Computes the distance between two coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x1 - (double) The x value in coordinate system units of the first coordinate.
        y1 - (double) The y value in coordinate system units of the first coordinate.
        x2 - (double) The x value in coordinate system units of the second coordinate.
        y2 - (double) The y value in coordinate system units of the second coordinate.
        Returns:
        Returns the distance between (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) as a double in meters.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgCoordinateSystemMeasureFailedException
        Since:
        4.0 Documented method name change for PHP

      • getAzimuth

        public double getAzimuth(MgCoordinate coord1,
                         MgCoordinate coord2)
        Computes the angle with respect to north of a vector formed by two coordinates.
        Overrides:
        getAzimuth in class MgMeasure
        Parameters:
        coord1 - (MgCoordinate) An MgCoordinate in coordinate system units that specifies the first coordinate.
        coord2 - (MgCoordinate) An MgCoordinate in coordinate system units that specifies the second coordinate.
        Returns:
        Returns the azimuth (Angle with respect to North) of the vector formed by coord1 and coord2.

      • getAzimuth

        public double getAzimuth(double x1,
                         double y1,
                         double x2,
                         double y2)
        Computes the angle with respect to the north of a vector formed by two coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x1 - (double) The x value in coordinate system units of the first coordinate.
        y1 - (double) The y value in coordinate system units of the first coordinate.
        x2 - (double) The x value in coordinate system units of the second coordinate.
        y2 - (double) The y value in coordinate system units of the second coordinate.
        Returns:
        Returns the azimuth (Angle with respect to the North) of the vector formed by (lon1, lat1) and (lon2, lat2).
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgCoordinateSystemMeasureFailedException
        Since:
        4.0 Documented method name change for PHP

      • getCoordinate

        public MgCoordinate getCoordinate(MgCoordinate coord,
                                  double azimuth,
                                  double distance)
        Computes a coordinate given a distance along a vector that is defined by a starting coordinate and an azimuth (Angle with respect to the North).
        Overrides:
        getCoordinate in class MgMeasure
        Parameters:
        coord - (MgCoordinate) An MgCoordinate object in coordinate system units that represents the start of the vector.
        azimuth - (double) An azimuth (Angle with respect to the North) that defines the direction of the vector.
        distance - (double) The distance along the vector to the desired coordinate in meters.
        Returns:
        Returns an MgCoordinate object containing the x and y values in coordinate system units of a coordinate that lies the given distance along the vector.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgCoordinateSystemMeasureFailedException

      • getCoordinate

        public MgCoordinate getCoordinate(double xStart,
                                  double yStart,
                                  double azimuth,
                                  double distance)
        Computes a coordinate a given distance along a vector that is defined by a starting coordinate and an azimuth (Angle with respect to the North).
        Parameters:
        xStart - (double) The x value in coordinate system units of the starting coordinate.
        yStart - (double) The y value in coordinate system units of the starting coordinate.
        azimuth - (double) An azimuth (Angle with respect to the North) that defines the direction of the vector.
        distance - (double) The distance along the vector to the desired coordinate in meters.
        Returns:
        Returns an MgCoordinate object containing the x and y value in ecoordinate system units of a coordinate that lies the given distance along the vector.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgCoordinateSystemMeasureFailedException
        Since:
        4.0 Documented method name change for PHP
